title: The Cassiopeia rework in a nutshell(visual)
body:
I really really liked Ginga's idea of using visual aides to get his point across so I'm gonna try and do that here. The Cass rework in a nutshell.

PBE pre-live:
http://i.imgur.com/PvKYXTI.jpg
**Riot**: "Hey guys we got you this awesome pizza!"
**Cass players**: "But we didn't order any pizza."
**Riot**: "its alright this ones on the house." c:
**Cass players**: "well that's cool I guess. Lets have a slice!"
*all grab a slice and take a bite*
**Cass players**: "ewwwwwwwwwwww this pizza is awful, its nothing like the pizza we like, it has none of the toppings we like whatsoever. Also the crust is burnt, the cheese is cold, and the toppings themselves are rancid."
**1 person who just started playing Cass after she was actually reworked**: "this pizza rules guys!"
**Riot**: "Glad to hear you like it fellas! We're gonna start shipping this all over based on your input!"
**Cass players**: "But we didn't....."
*Riot employee walks away*

Live(Lets talk Cassiopeia):
**Cass players**: "thank goodness you're back there's been a huge misunderstanding! The pizza you left us was awful, please we never want anymore of that pizza."
**Riot**: "well you're in luck because I just brought out a new pizza! A better pizza!"
http://i.imgur.com/cPEIEXv.jpg
*Cass players look at the pizza*
**Cass players**: "but but... that's just the same pizza... you didn't change anything at all" :c
**Riot**: "whats that? You like the new pizza? Glad to hear cause its shipping out everywhere tomorrow for a special event we're having!"
**Cass players**: "No please don't there's so many things wrong with that pizza, so many things that make it awful."
**Riot**: "Oop is that the time? Gotta run guys, that big events happening tomorrow and we gotta have everything ready for it."
*Riot employee walks away*

MONTHS LATER:
**Riot**: "Hey sorry guys. Turns out people don't like the new pizza. Oh btw sorry we haven't been around in a while we've been busy with other pizza events." :(
**Cass players**: "Oh thank goodness you're back, these past few months have been awful. We thought you completely abandoned us. We had a ton of good discussion about whats wrong with the new pizza while you were gone though." :)
**Riot**: "Well that's awesome cause we would love to hear it to improve the pizza."
**Cass players**: "Well the problems are that the toppings you put on the pizza are completely wrong. It has nothing to do with the fact that the pizza itself was burnt and cooked improperly, its more about the toppings themselves."
*Riot employee nods his head*
**Riot**: "ok I think I gotcha so what we're gonna do is change the toppings a bit, you see these anchovies we had added? Gone now. Now we're replacing them with sardines which are even fishier and saltier to really bring out that fishy tasty you guys love! Hows that sound!? Also we're gonna make sure the pizza is cooked properly this time so there's no issues." :)
http://i.imgur.com/2bxFUAG.jpg
**Cass players**: "NOOOOOOOO, STOPPPPPPPPPPP! We don't like that fishy taste, it completely ruins the pizza, I mean we love the fact that you're fixing the cooking of the pizza but it still is gonna taste awful regardless."
*riot employee walks away*

Current situation:
*Riot employee walks up*
**Cass players**: "Hey can you please please just stop putting these toppings on this pizza... PLEASE! You could even have a discussion with us to see what would be a cool direction for new pizza toppings. We all have come up with a ton of really cool ideas."
**Riot**: "We hear your concerns, and to try and remedy this we have made minimal changes to the pizza. The delicious sardines are still intact so don't worry, and the pizza has now been cooked properly."
http://i.imgur.com/6JsGKLW.jpg
**Cass players**: "WE HATE SARDINES THOUGH! NO ONE LIKES SARDINES!
**1 person who just started playing Cass after she was actually reworked**: "I like it!"
**Cass players:** "Ok MOST of us don't like it. We just want our tasty pizza back, it may have been kinda similar to some other pizza's but it had a special taste to it that we loved and no other pizza has that specific taste. PLEASEEEEEEEEE" :c
*Riot employee walks away without saying a word*

replies.body: I wish this could be considered hyperbole.
As do I :(
Laughed and cried at the same time, this is both fantastic and accurate
Glad you enjoyed it. ^^
Cass wasn't reworked to suit cass mains. get. over. it.
and who,pray-tell was the rework meant for?
For game health.
Syndra, Xerath, and Ziggs say hi. Did you even play the original Cassiopeia, or are you just repeating what Riot told you?

> For game health.

She was one of the most balanced mages in the game
Why is the damage on Cass's W so pathetic now? I just don't see why it has to be so low.

> Why is the damage on Cass's W so pathetic now? I just don't see why it has to be so low.

They have NEVER explained why her Miasma is so weak! What was the inherent need for it to do no damage? Zigg's Minefield serves the same purpose and has a 5% weaker slow, with MORE damage, and it STARTS at maximum Area of Effect instead of Miasma which grows to maximum size over time.
Actually they did. It's because it allows twin fang to be spammed. Which, is a complete BS reason, but you know hey, whatever stashu wants, since it's already on the pizza.

This is non-constructive, possibly inflammatory, and risks hurting those of us trying to make a real impact.

.... yet I can't stop myself from up-voting.

I deny nothing and I regret nothing haha. I know its not necessarily the most constructive thing but seriously SERIOUSLY, this is how I've felt over the past few months. It hurts man. ;n;

Side note, I've made other more well thought and constructive post on both the boards and the old forum.

> This is non-constructive, possibly inflammatory, and risks hurting those of us trying to make a real impact.
> 
> .... yet I can't stop myself from up-voting.

Embrace the dark side padawan! upvote!

honestly is there a point to this thread?

Nothing will change based on it, why would a multi-million dollar company listen to the vocal minority. If they would have seen a drastic decrease in cass sales, they may have changed something, but her play rate and i imagine her sale rate remained the same and it had a small spike, i imagine, whenever they did the small changes to her. 

your enjoyment in the end doesn't matter, sales matter. If the sales indicate a change needs to be made, it will happen. They do have to invest man hours into this, they have to invest thousands upon thousands of dollars just for a single small change. If this was your company and it wasn't going to amount to much of if any profit, would you do it? really? I know i wouldn't

Even though you try to dismiss this as a "vocal minority", the stats prove otherwise: her pick rate has remained abysmal and actually gone down, her desperada skin was butchered, and her default model was not updated to look like her splash.

Also no, they do NOT have to invest man hours into this.  Nobody fucking asked for a goddamn Cass rework, nobody wanted a Cass rework, her pick rate was so low that her impact on game health was miniscule.  She didn't need updating for the Shurima event.  Touching Cass was a waste of money and the backlash against it is so real, even reddit doesn't like it; considering reddit fellates Riot for everything, that's actually impressive.
Next patch: even more sardines.

This rework has been a mess from the start to now. It started off horribly when Stashu created a discussion on the old GD board a day before his "rework" hit the PBE. He then vanished out of thin air for weeks, only to come back and listen to those members of the community that liked where the rework was heading. He continues to ignore player feedback and pursue his dream of making Cassiopeia a "hyper scaling late game carry" when 95% of the community wants the old poison mage, zone control and DoT mage that she once was.

At first sight, I loved the new Cass, but then I realized that she was suddenly crazy weak early on.  None of my spells really felt like they were doing anything compared to before.  She's still fun late, but I had to abandon the Q-centric strat in favor of spamming fang, and that still feels like much ado to do nothing.

The problem is E is completely unreliable in comparison to old Q in terms of damage,(trying to take an objective stance on this) because its not only like I have to land a Q, but I also have to follow up with my E. There's definitely more to it then that but I'm off for all you can eat sushi, tata~
You're making me crave pizza!

> You're making me crave pizza!

Be careful what you wish for.

I honestly never wanted a cass rework. I mean I didn't play her a shit ton, but she was still fun and did a lot of damage when played right.

This is probably one of the worst reworks so far imo. At least Karma actually got better with her rework after completely changing who she is.

It's like riot kept what Cass is and then made her into complete crap.
The Cass we have now is definitely a Little Caesar's hot and ready (aka cheap and shitty) pizza with extra head-lice toppings.

I bet King Cobra is that one only person who liked the rework. Cobra if you are reading this, it is not a hate comment or anything :P. But it just seems you're the only person who liked the current Cassio rework

=P I know a TON of people who love the rework. There is just no reason for them to post on these forums because they have nothing to complain about. It happens with every rework/change. The people who dislike it are vocal because they want change and the people who do like it don't have a reason to post because they are content. If you go on reddit and read posts about Cass, a lot of people are supportive of it. 

That being said, I think the whole Cass rework thing has turned into a circlejerk here, and I really don't see much more productivity coming from Riot communicating with the community on these boards unless they have very large plans in store for Cass (which really doesn't seem likely since Stashu said they are happy with how she is turning out). People are complaining that Riot isn't listening to them, like in this thread, and, to be blunt, I think it's really immature.

Cass wasn't even 'reworked'. She got a new passive and her power was shifted around. She literally plays out exactly as she did before (if you played her optimally) and it completely baffles me that people are saying things like "you took away her poison!!!" etc. etc. because it is all right there. She still poisons enemies and she still spams Twin Fang. Riot made it **explicitly **clear that they did not want Cass to be an AOE poison mage that can get away with high damage through just Q and W yet people STILL complain that "wah my Q and W doesn't do anything on its own". Riot compromised and gave her Q its damage back if you can muster up a modicum of skill and throw two Twin Fangs at them after using it. They even made it easier to land and made it easier to close the gap in early levels and people STILL aren't happy. I used to feel bad for these guys, but part of me now just wants to say grow up and get over it - it's a video game character and there are bigger things in life to worry about. This 'rework' isn't an 'abomination' or 'disgusting' or whatever sensationalist descriptors people have been using to describe it. 

Yeah, she's a bit weak on live right now, but the changes going through will help her immensely. She will be MUCH more capable of carrying games that she is in, and that really only leaves tweaking the passive to make it feel a bit better.

Ok so I have a response to basically all of this.

> =P I know a TON of people who love the rework. There is just no reason for them to post on these forums because they have nothing to complain about. It happens with every rework/change. The people who dislike it are vocal because they want change and the people who do like it don't have a reason to post because they are content. If you go on reddit and read posts about Cass, a lot of people are supportive of it. 

First off if theres SO MANY people who support this rework then please explain to me why her pick rate dropped to under 50 percent of what it was pre rework. Its now sitting at 1.2 percent of all games, oh boy that sure is a ton of people woo boy, you got me. Side note, a TON of people on reddit are also against it soooooooooo I meannnnnnnnnnnn.

> That being said, I think the whole Cass rework thing has turned into a circlejerk here, and I really don't see much more productivity coming from Riot communicating with the community on these boards unless they have very large plans in store for Cass (which really doesn't seem likely since Stashu said they are happy with how she is turning out). People are complaining that Riot isn't listening to them, like in this thread, and, to be blunt, I think it's really immature.

Ok you say it turned into a "circle jerk" well listen here buddy. people have been talking about the issues with this rework since it was proposed on PBE months ago. There was a literal crap storm of negative post from the get go. Most of them fell on deaf ears. Heck just before the rework dropped on live Riot started the "Lets talk Cassiopeia" thread. I dare you to go back to that thread and read through the FIRST FEW PAGES. 90 percent of the post are negative, or completely against the rework. Please, be my guest. Side note, that thread went on for a full 300 pages of discussion almost completely devoid of Riot involvement for MONTHSSSSSS. Also you know what, you say we're being immature for speaking out against the rework? Well you know what? We're all consumers, we put time and money into this game and it kinda really sucks when a company decides to completely ignore our, the consumers, opinions. All we ask in return is that our opinions are listened to. But no. No matter how much criticism we drop on this rework, no matter how many post we make, no matter how many numbers we crunch, or well thought out post are written, almost all of it falls on deaf ears.

> Cass wasn't even 'reworked'. She got a new passive and her power was shifted around. She literally plays out exactly as she did before (if you played her optimally) and it completely baffles me that people are saying things like "you took away her poison!!!" etc. etc. because it is all right there. She still poisons enemies and she still spams Twin Fang. Riot made it **explicitly **clear that they did not want Cass to be an AOE poison mage that can get away with high damage through just Q and W yet people STILL complain that "wah my Q and W doesn't do anything on its own". Riot compromised and gave her Q its damage back if you can muster up a modicum of skill and throw two Twin Fangs at them after using it. They even made it easier to land and made it easier to close the gap in early levels and people STILL aren't happy. I used to feel bad for these guys, but part of me now just wants to say grow up and get over it - it's a video game character and there are bigger things in life to worry about. This 'rework' isn't an 'abomination' or 'disgusting' or whatever sensationalist descriptors people have been using to describe it. 

I'm not gonna try and sensationalize this I'm just going to say your early and mid game is absolute trash compared to a ton of other champions played mid lane. Her late game power spike isn't even worth the trouble you have to go through to get there. Even champs like {{champion:75}} or {{champion:67}} have better early and mid games and they provide just as much of a late game as Cass currently provides now. That combined with how inconsistent her damage actually is makes her completely pointless to play over basically any other mid laner. I could name a massive laundry list of champions who do everything Cass does but better in early and mid game stages and then still be just as powerful as her late game.
 
> Yeah, she's a bit weak on live right now, but the changes going through will help her immensely. She will be MUCH more capable of carrying games that she is in, and that really only leaves tweaking the passive to make it feel a bit better.

The juries still out on this. It took him MONTHS to even do something as small as this, why should I trust that this will actually change anything. Also you know what, I just wish for ONCE.... FOR..... ONCEEEEEEE. That they would freaking ASK, JUST FREAKING ASK what WE, the consumers would like to see in terms of changes. But what ever dude, the new changes including the ones being dropped in 4.21 fit YOUR playstyle so obviously you could care less. Also I reiterate something I feel is important. 1.2 percent. That's her pick rate right now, that's the TON of people you mentioned like the new Cass. That's like nothing. This rework hasn't done anything to help this champion, its only hurt her and the people who enjoyed her and none of us even had a say in it. So I feel like the only reason you're justifying the changes is because they fit into your playstyle, not the preferred playstyle. 
(I'm not even mentioning her win rate btw because it is completely irrelevant even if it is negative.)

AFAIK, she was not reworked because she was deemed "OP" or lacked counterplay or anything, but because she was weak in the meta. I also remember someone mentioning that strong DOTs are "anti-fun" because it's hard to tell how much damage you've taken/are taking. I also remember a rioter saying they want champions to have one, distinct and unique role/experience and do that one thing well.

Well, as far as I can see both reasons are crappy in this instance. Cass *did* have a unique playstyle - she felt uniquely poison-y, in a way completely different from Singed, Teemo, or Brand. As for the "anti-fun" of DOT's, this applies to all DOT champions and should be addressed via visual indicators NOT (more obvious icon, purple healthbar, etc).

The effectiveness of DOTs isn't about an opponent "not realizing" they are losing HP, it's puts them into a "time management" counterplay. They can all-in before the damage kills them, since they have some time before it does. They can run back and try and heal up.

Picking one champ who specializes in DOTs, and than nerfing those DOTS to put focus on the other spells, is silly. I'll admit I've only played Cass one time in an aram, but I've racked up tons of games as old Cass, and my inital experience of her update was "ugh, she doesn't poison anymore. all i can do is run around throwing fangs at everyone. I know longer feel like a cool, venomous threat in lane ....instead I feel like some sort of weak mage-nasus who spends the entire early game hoping be relevant.".

Initial verdict (admittedly based on 1 aram): terrible.

Also, it's understood that Riot will never completely revert a reworked champ. Not only is it doubtful they'd change their minds so much, but it would make them look bad, like they'd made a mistake, and also give the impression that they'll cave when a bunch of players rage over something. New Cass is, unfortunately, here to stay.

DOTs actually have more counterplay than straight damage, imo. If you get DOT'd and know you're dead, you can all-in instead of running. Or, you can run before you're actually low, to avoid 

icking on one champ who specializes in DOTS and just making the actual *D* in DOT useless.


I don't anybody was ever asking for a late-game hypercarry focus, and I'm not sure why they chose that (I recall

I'm a solo laner who loves tackling difficult champions with a high reward potential. Pre-work Cass seemed to me to be a niche pick; a champ who was powerful but because of her lofty skill floor wasn't played as often. Which was tantalizingly fantastic to me. Around late summer I decided I finally wanted to learn her, but I heard she was getting a rework, so I figured I'd wait until after the fact to start.

And once the rework hit and I did try her out she was certainly difficult to do well with, so I didn't think much of it because difficulty is what I expected. But after a few games passed and I started getting the mechanics down, I realized that the bulk of this difficulty was coming from an inability to hold her own in lane and a power rise delayed way too long. Plus, getting those stacks is horrendously BORING. Sure, if I survive to late game my E does mind-boggling damage to the enemy, which was fun for a while, but it's all just slapping down some form of poison and spamming a point-and-click ability like mad. Cheap and unsatisfying. It doesn't feel so beautifully TOXIC, like the Cass I remember seeing played and was excited to play. 

I'm just sad beyond belief that I never picked her up before. I feel like I missed something WAY better and it's becoming more and more clear that as long as Stashu keeps his head buried in the dirt, which he's excelled at doing so far, it's not coming back.

I just bought her when the rework was released. I didn't know about it. I expected to play the zoning bitchy poisonous champion that I saw others playing and that seduced me. Instead, I found out that, even after the trouble of landing my Qs, they dealt almost no damage. That I had to Q EE to do anything meaningful, and that almost every Mid Champion out traded me in the process. It isn't until level 14 or so that she starts doing anything meaningful at all. Why can she be the poison queen when Teemo's poison feels much better than hers since he only needs to land autoattacks.
I don't know. I tried everything to make her viable in game, but it just doesn't work. You get rekt in the lane phase no matter what you do, unless you have friendly teammates that abandon their lanes constantly to help you...
It feels nothing like her. It feels shitty. It doesn't feel rewarding at all.

>  That I had to Q EE to do anything meaningful

Actually no, it's

Q EE ...Q...

That amplification doesn't do all that much unless you re-apply the Q due in part to missile travel time and cast time eating up most of her Q's duration already, so you need another Q to actually make that amplification do anything.

> >  That I had to Q EE to do anything meaningful
> 
> Actually no, it's
> 
> Q EE ...Q...
> 
> That amplification doesn't do all that much unless you re-apply the Q due in part to missile travel time and cast time eating up most of her Q's duration already, so you need another Q to actually make that amplification do anything.

54367

wow really?  

so to do even enough dmg to make it worth it you have to be in close range long enough for a leBlanc,fizz,swain,ahri,akali,ziggs,syndra,ori,nid,mord,morg,kat,fid,annie, or anvia to 100-0 you?  Just to do what 1/4th to 1/3rd health them?

I had bought her before the re-work... wonder if I can get a refund still.
Not a cass player, still laughed...... now I should get out of here before you kill me for liking the pizza.

Don't worry, we don't bite *bares fangs*.......
........ much. :3
its like the FCC thinking but vise versa,if 1 person likes the changes then EVERYONE likes it,i swear riot has rifle barrels for eyes,level of tunnel vision
Cassie used to be one of my favourites, now I wont even play her in a bot game
Too bad Rito will just ignore this thread as well.

Funny 'cause it's true.

To a larger extend however -  it's saddening  :/
annnnnnnddddd this is why I play smite now. Never heard of an active community being part of a MOBA game when i played lol
this picture also helps readers to further understand the Cass rework
Rito Plz. -.- Do it for da {{champion:69}}

So I played a few games as Cassiopeia 4.21.



It wasn't a positive experience.


I mean, I'm not surprised that I didn't enjoy her at all. I'm not surprised she struggles against champions with even a bit of mobility or that her Passive pisses you off more than it makes you feel powerful and shit. When I DID win, it's purely because that Katarina was an idiot.

However...you can't criticize and provide feedback if you don't suffer first.

OK so I'm kind of a noob as S4 was my first season. (And I'm not that good of a player because I am in bronze 3) and I don't understand why ppl hate the cass rework. I never played the original and I only use her as support ever so often and I do decent but I to me teemo is a better support than she is. 

Can someone explain to me how she got nerfed exactly? And was she nerfed worse than Irelia (because I've heard that was the most awful nerf)

Everyone is gonna have their own specific reason for disliking (or liking) the re-work, but I think most basically.

The rework did a 180 on her power curve. Cass used to be one of the defining definitions of "lane bully." She was strong early & mid, and could still scale well into late game. A mechanically intense champion who was high risk / high reward.

The nerf was to her AP ratios. Q&W ratios were absolutely gutted and basically became utility spells (even though the Q speed buff was also dramatically nerfed at lvl 1, making it pretty useless in utility until it's rank 3), and also slightly to her Ult. All her dmg was loaded into her E, which was given a QoL update. Before, E would reset to a .5 second CD if it *hit* a target that was already poisoned. Due to travel time of the spell, this made the actual CD time of the spell anywhere from .5~ if you're right next to a target, up to .7-1 second, if you were farther away. With the QoL update, it made the .5 reset happen *if the target is poisoned,* meaning you can **potentially** double your E output in trades.

What I remember loving most about Old Cass was turning those early-mid game ganks into 1v2 double-kills. A well timed Ult, take out the lower-health target, and then either finish off the 2nd enemy, or die but have the satisfaction of having the last tic or two your poison (which they stupidly sat in while trading you down), finish them off as they walk away thinking they've won. Always #worth.

Edit: They also nerfed the early AP ratios of E, so it's not even of the same ratios until rank 3. But w/e. A lot of these things are being addressed in patch 4.21, which I'm gonna be excited to play when I get home. Q is getting a flat 20% movespeed buff at all ranks, and E is gonna add a poison amp debuff that'll stack up to 40%, and if you start your combo with a W, you could get some pretty decent dmg off I imagine.
Shit, did Stashu just temporarily go black there?

I laughed more than I should have.

I feel bad now.

I have it!
The solution!
All Cass main just have to put on gimp suits and become masochists!
They can even make a new skin! Bondage Submissive Casseopia!
It's so simple!
I'm the guy who started playing her after the rework.  Should I be ashamed or something?  Because I really do enjoy her as she is now.

Its not that you should be ashamed but what I've seen is that a lot of the Cass rework supporters never even played the original Cass. So its like they get a hold of new Cass and are like "WOW this champion feels awesome!" When its like... she was basically the same champion pre-rework but without the monotonous elements and uninteresting playslyle... you just never played her so you can't see our side of the fence. 

Like you would understand if you played her pre-rework. That's all I'm trying to say, and it gets kinda frustrating when we have all these new Cass players playing her just BECAUSE she got reworked without even knowing what she was before and how much fun she used to be. ALSO on that note we get a lot of people who didn't play pre-rework Cass who just spout off what Riot told us about how she was "toxic" and too much of a "bully" when that's absolutely not the case. She was much MUCH less oppressive than a truck load of other mid laners. :(

Also don't down vote this guy he's said nothing wrong.

I guess these are fair points.  I'm used to mid-laners with boring early games (Veigar, etc.) so a weak early didn't bother me too much.  What I'm about to ask is a genuine question, and I'm not trying to troll you.  If she wasn't "toxic, bully, etc.", what sort of counterplay could her opponents use pre-rework, compared to now?  I can't remember ever fighting one pre-rework, so I don't know, but I assume you do.
